eligibility.points: You must be a student who identifies as a woman or non-binary, enrolled in an accredited degree program at a college, university or high school at the time of applying.

You must remain a full-time student enrolled in an accredited degree program at a college or university at the time of the celebration (September 2022). Those graduating prior to the celebration are not eligible unless accepted to another related degree program (such as a M.S. or PhD program).
Show satisfactory progress toward a degree such as, but not limited to, computer science, electrical engineering, human-computer interaction, math, physics, or management information systems.
Be able to demonstrate an interest in computer science.
You must be at least 18 years of age by September 19, 2022
Full time undergraduate or graduate students during the 2022-23 school year.
Pursuing a degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering and computer science or software engineering.
Attending school in the US, India, UK, Serbia or Australia.
Minimum 3.5 GPA in countries that utilize GPA scoring.
Demonstrates strong leadership and communication skills.
Demonstrated record of co-curricular activity and community service
The applicant must be an undergraduate student in good academic standing for the duration of the program.
The applicant must be at least 18 years old.
Must commit to 8 meetings with your Campus Directors and Fellows over the course of the program.
Working or plan to work on a project between August-November 2022 that advances at least one Sustainable Development Goal
Applications are reviewed on rolling basis and eligible students will proceed to second and final levels.
Only Professional Degree Courses eligible for Scholarships are B.E/B.Tech,Integrated 5-Year Dual-Degree M.Tech ,MBBS,BPharm and LLB.
Only First-Year applicants beginning their studies in B.E.,B.Tech,Integrated 5-Year Dual Degree M.Tech,MBBS,B.Pharm ans LLB are eligible.
Applicants are expected to have passed their Higher Senior Secondary/ Pre-University/Intermediate/CBSE/ISC or equivalent Board qualifying examination after 2019.
Admission to Professional Degree Courses/Institutions is based on the Merit Rank at state or Natioanl level Entrance exams, or through a counselling process conducted at the state level.
Annual Income should be less than Rs.2.5L .
FOSSEE invites applications for the Semester-long Internship 2022.
The students get an opportunity to work with FOSSEE for one semester.
This is a remote internship with continuous support and mentoring.
To get shortlisted for the internship, Select a project and choose a screening task from the table given below.
Then you need to complete at least one of the screening tasks. The selection will be purely based on the evaluation criteria of each screening task.
Outreachy provides internships in open source and open science.
Outreachy internship projects may include programming, research, user experience,documentation, graphical design, data science, marketing, user advocacy, or event planning.
$7,000 USD total internship stipend
Both interns and mentors work remotely
3 months - internships run May to August, or December to March
A place where they can meet mentors from OpenSource Organisations and contribute them under guidance,network and'bring them Open Source Culture' with enthusiasam .
Panel of members would be available for any kind of help or doubts.
It would provide OpenForce specific issues which participants can reslove in the contribution period.
Participating in GSSoC is an opportunity to upgrade your Github Profile .
Enrich yourselves to learn,explore ,improve,enhance,build connections and become a team player to nourish your personality.
Don't miss a chance to get well-versed with Open-Source and essential tools like Git and Github under the supervision of excellent mentors.
